details.body: Implementation and transitional provisions, application and interpretation of the Immigration Rules and public funds clarification.

sections.title: General provisions regarding leave to enter or remain in the UK
sections.summary: Rules for all immigration categories.

sections.title: Part 1: persons seeking to enter or remain in the UK for visits
sections.summary: Studying in the UK including child, college, and university students.

sections.title: Part 2: persons seeking to enter or remain in the UK for studies
sections.summary: Getting digital services to people who arenâ€™t online

sections.title: Part 3: persons seeking to enter or remain in the UK in an "au pair" placement, as a working holidaymaker or for training or work experience
sections.summary: Rules for family members of people in the UK as on work experience or as a working holidaymaker.

sections.title: Part 4: persons seeking to enter or remain in the UK for employment
sections.summary: Working in the UK including work permit, highly skilled, representatives of overseas business and domestic workers.

sections.title: Part 5: persons seeking to enter or remain in the UK as a businessman, self-employed person, investor, writer, composer or artist
sections.summary: These paragraphs were deleted in 2008.

sections.title: Part 6: points-based system
sections.summary: Rules for Tier 1, Tier 2, Tier 4 and Tier 5 of the UK points-based system including entrepreneurs, investors, temporary workers and students.

sections.title: Part 7: other categories
sections.summary: Including exercising the rights of access to a child, retired persons of independent means and HM forces.

sections.title: Part 8: family members
sections.summary: Rules for people applying to come to or stay in the UK with a member of their family including spouses or partners, children and grandparents.

sections.title: Part 9: grounds for refusal
sections.summary: General reasons why entry clearance, leave to enter or leave to remain in the UK can be refused or curtailed (paragraphs A320 to 324).

sections.title: Part 10: registering with the police
sections.summary: Situations where foreign nationals are required to register with the police (paragraphs 325 to 326).

sections.title: Part 11: asylum
sections.summary: Rules for people applying for asylum in the UK (paragraphs 326A to 352G).

sections.title: Part 11A: temporary protection
sections.summary: Granting temporary protection in the event of a mass influx of displaced people (paragraphs 354 to 356B).

sections.title: Part 11B: non-EU asylum applicants
sections.summary: Asylum applicants who are not nationals of an EU member state (paragraphs 357 to 361).

sections.title: Part 12: asylum procedure and rights of appeal
sections.summary: Further submissions procedure, rights of appeal and exceptional circumstances (paragraphs 353 to 353B).

sections.title: Part 13: deportation
sections.summary: Deportation orders, procedure and Article 8 of the Human Rights Convention (paragraphs A362 to 400).

sections.title: Part 14: stateless people
sections.summary: Definition of a stateless person and how they can come to or settle in the UK (paragraphs 401 to 416).

sections.title: Appendix 1: UK visa requirements
sections.summary: Countries whose citizens need a visa to enter the UK.

sections.title: Appendix 2: police registration
sections.summary: Countries whose citizens are required to register with the police.

sections.title: Appendix 6: academic subjects that need a certificate
sections.summary: Academic subjects that need a certificate from the Foreign and Commonwealth Office.

sections.title: Appendix 7: overseas workers in private households
sections.summary: Statement of the terms and conditions of employment required for overseas domestic workers in private households in the UK.

sections.title: Appendix A: attributes
sections.summary: Points needed for attributes for applicants in Tiers 1, 2, 4 and 5 of the points-based system.

sections.title: Appendix Armed Forces
sections.summary: Rules for members of the armed forces, civilian employees and their families.

sections.title: Appendix B: English language
sections.summary: English language requirements for Tier 1 and 2 applications.

sections.title: Appendix C: maintenance funds
sections.summary: Maintenance funds requirements for Tiers 1, 2, 4 and 5 of the points-based system.

sections.title: Appendix D: highly skilled migrants
sections.summary: Rules for highly skilled migrants from 31 March 2008.

sections.title: Appendix E: maintenance funds PBS dependants
sections.summary: Maintenance funds requirements for family members of points-based system applicants.

sections.title: Appendix F: archived Immigration Rules
sections.summary: Collection of archived Immigration Rules for categories which have now closed.

sections.title: Appendix FM: family members
sections.summary: Rules for people who want to come to or stay in the UK based on family life with a British citizen, settled person or refugee.

sections.title: Appendix FM-SE: family members specified evidence
sections.summary: Specified evidence that applicants under appendix FM, appendix Armed Forces and other relevant rules must provide.

sections.title: Appendix G: Youth Mobility Scheme
sections.summary: Countries and territories taking part in the Tier 5 Youth Mobility Scheme and annual allocations of places.

sections.title: Appendix H: Tier 4 documentary requirements
sections.summary: Applicants who are subject to different documentary requirements under Tier 4 of the points-based system.

sections.title: Appendix I: pay rules for Tier 2 settlement
sections.summary: Salary requirements for some Tier 2 settlement applicants from 6 April 2016.

sections.title: Appendix J: codes of practice for skilled work
sections.summary: Codes of practice for Tier 2 and 5 sponsors, and employers of work permit holders.

sections.title: Appendix K: shortage occupation list
sections.summary: Skilled jobs where there is a recognised shortage of workers that could sensibly be filled by Tier 2 migrants.

sections.title: Appendix KoLL
sections.summary: Knowledge of the English language and life in the UK.

sections.title: Appendix L: Tier 1 competent body criteria
sections.summary: Criteria set by organisations which endorse Tier 1 (exceptional talent) applications.

sections.title: Appendix M: sports governing bodies
sections.summary: Sports governing bodies for Tier 2 (Sportsperson) and Tier 5 (Temporary Worker - Creative and Sporting) applications.

sections.title: Appendix N: authorised exchange schemes
sections.summary: Approved Tier 5 government authorised exchange schemes.

sections.title: Appendix O: approved English language tests
sections.summary: List of tests approved by the Home Office for English language requirements.

sections.title: Appendix P: lists of financial institutions
sections.summary: Lists of financial institutions whose financial statements are, or are not, accepted.

sections.title: Appendix Q: overseas domestic workers in diplomatic households
sections.summary: Statement of employment terms and conditions needed for overseas domestic workers in diplomatic households in the UK.

sections.title: Appendix R: festivals for entertainer visitors
sections.summary: List of recognised musical and artistic UK festivals that amateur and professional entertainer visitors can take part in.

sections.title: Appendix T: tuberculosis screening
sections.summary: List of countries where a TB certificate is needed to come to the UK for more than 6 months.
